headline: Former Man Utd star confirms retirement aged 34 after three transfers in last two years
body: Morgan Schneiderlin was signed by Louis van Gaal at Manchester United in 2015, helping the Red Devils win the FA Cup before falling out of favour under Jose Mourinho
Former Manchester United midfielder Morgan Schneiderlin has announced his retirement from football aged 34.

Schneiderlin spent 18 months at Old Trafford after joining from Southampton in 2015 and won the FA Cup. The £25million signing also made a total of 47 appearances for United, most of which came during his first season under Louis van Gaal.

After Jose Mourinho took charge, Schneiderlin soon found himself out of favour and moved to Everton in January 2017, where he spent the next three-and-a-half years. A move to Nice in his homeland of France followed before a loan spell with Australian outfit Western Sydney Wanderers.

Schneiderlin signed for Turkish club Konyaspor August 2023 but had his contract terminated by mutual agreement just nine days later. The Frenchman quickly found his next destination and played for Greek side AE Kifisia last season, his third move in the last two years.

After his contract expired in June, Schneiderlin took time to consider his future and on Friday announced the end of his nomadic career via Instagram. "For me, the chapter as a football player is coming to an end, which is why, before I start writing a new chapter in my professional career, I want to take a moment to express my gratitude," the 15-time France international wrote.

"Thank you to Racing Club de Strasbourg, who gave me an opportunity at the age of five, and where I stayed until I was 18. Thank you to the coaches I encountered from my youngest age there, thank you to the Racing training centre, thank you to those who believed in me.

"Thank you to Southampton FC, I truly spent my best years with you. Thank you to Manchester United, one of the greatest clubs in the world. Thank you to Everton FC, thank you to OGC Nice, thank you to Sydney Wanderers, thank you to Kifisia FC."

Having helped Southampton reach the Premier League and establish themselves as a top-flight side, Schneiderlin's move to Van Gaal's United was seen as somewhat of a coup. The 34-year-old wasn't fancied by new manager Jose Mourinho, though, and in late 2016 he asked to join Everton, a decision which he'd go on to regret.

"I learned a lot from my departure from Manchester United. I had played 40 matches the previous season with Manchester," Schneiderlin told L'Equipe. "When I come back from the Euros, I take ten days off and I play very little for three, four months. Then, I have Ronald Koeman and Everton who are pushing hard to get me, every day, from October.

"I will remember it all my life: I should have played against Liverpool, starter, and the coach (Mourinho) comes to see me. He tells me he doesn't feel me inside the group. I tell him that indeed, with what has happened in the last three months, I am not in it and I want to go to Everton. I regretted it very quickly."

headline: Ruud van Nistelrooy's unseen moment with Alejandro Garnacho sums up why Man Utd hired him
body: Ruud van Nistelrooy has a prominent role among Erik ten Hag's Manchester United staff and his impact can already be seen on a matchday following the club's Premier League win over Fulham
Ruud van Nistelrooy is already showing his expertise in man-management after joining Erik ten Hag's coaching staff this summer.

The former Manchester United sharpshooter returned to the club in an assistant role having already started his own managerial career with PSV Eindhoven, before departing the Eredivisie club little over 12 months ago do to lack of support. The Red Devils recruited the 48-year-old with hope he could help reinstill a winning mentality at Old Trafford.

While that will include ensuring that lofty demands are met each day for the 13-time Premier League champions, Van Nistelrooy has shown after just one game he has the ability to put an arm around the shoulder. After United's 1-0 win over Fulham, the ex-Netherlands international came onto the pitch to greet players, putting an arm around goalscorer Joshua Zirkzee, and also embracing Andre Onana.

The Dutchman made a beeline for Alejandro Garnacho following the full time whistle however, with the young winger looking frustrated, far away from the dugout. After arriving on the field as a substitute, the 20-year-old provided an assist for Zirkzee but was left to rue a dreadful miss in stoppage time with only Bernd Leno to beat.

Van Nistelrooy quickly noticed Garnacho's reaction and made his way to the player to clasp hands and share a few words. The Argentina ace still trudged into the tunnel but it was a moment of class from the coach.

Though Garnacho was left discontented, Zirkzee was much happier with his cameo. The former Bologna forward produced an impressive strike in the 87th minute to start life at Old Trafford on a very positive note.
The 23-year-old described his move as a 'dream' thus far. "To win here in my first home game and to grab a goal, it couldn't be better," he told Sky Sports.
"I've been told [scoring at the Stretford End] is one of the best feelings at Man Utd. I'm so thankful and blessed I could experience it in my first game. It's an amazing feeling.

"At the end of the day we got the win, that's all we wanted. I can't really explain the feeling, it's just very nice. I feel very warm here. It's a great team. We want to achieve something great. It's been amazing, it's been a dream actually.

headline: Ex-Man Utd star Phil Jones announces retirement aged 32 and confirms new career
body: Phil Jones spent 12 years at Manchester United following his move from Blackburn Rovers, helping the Red Devils to win the Premier League, FA Cup and Europa League
Phil Jones has announced his retirement from football at the age of 32.

The defender spent 12 years as a senior player at Old Trafford after moving from fellow top-flight side Blackburn Rovers. He made 229 appearances for the Red Devils and won the Premier League, FA Cup and Europa league.

However, the ex-England centre-back managed just 13 appearances in his final three seasons at United due to a slew of long-term injuries. The defender left as a free agent in 2023, then spent the following season in a coaching role with the Red Devils’ academy.

And in an interview with the BBC on Saturday on the opening weekend of the Premier League, the former Blackburn starlet officially confirmed his playing days were behind him as he pursues a new venture in coaching.

“My career finished shorter than I would have liked,” said Jones, who won 27 caps for England. "[I'm] glass half full. [I have] completed my A licence and I want to get out there and challenge myself in coaching.

"Ultimately I want to take charge of a team. I am determined to get there." Jones added: "I did everything I could [to return to playing] but with so many rehabs I was coming back from, it has an effect on you and your family."

A product of Blackburn’s youth system, Jones’ move to United from Blackburn materialised after the defender’s impressive performance in a 1-1 draw between the sides on the day United clinched the title under manager Sir Alex Ferguson.

The Scottish manager was reportedly impressed with the teenage defender’s precocious conviction and leadership skills. In the summer of 2011, Jones signed for United in a £16.5million deal, after which Ferguson claimed he could go on to be the club’s greatest ever player.

"The way he is looking, he could be our best ever player," Ferguson said. "He may be one of the best players we have ever had, no matter where we play him. At 21 years of age, he is going to be a phenomenal player. He can play anywhere on the pitch. He has such a massive influence, with his instinct and reading of the game."

headline: Jadon Sancho swap deal holds key to Man Utd hijacking Liverpool's first summer transfer
body: Liverpool are the only Premier League club that has yet to make a signing this summer, and Manchester United could be set to hijack their first signing - and Jadon Sancho has a role to play
Jadon Sancho’s future could hold the key to Manchester United hijacking Liverpool ’s move for Valencia goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili.
It is understood Liverpool have already agreed personal terms with Mamardashvili, 23, who starred for Georgia in their run to the last 16 of Euro 2024.
The deal could be the first signing of the Arne Slot era, but sources say the 6ft 6in keeper is also very much open to a move to Old Trafford.
United, who beat visitors Fulham 1-0 on Friday night in the Premier League ’s season opener, are long-time admirers of Mamardashvili but need to trim their squad before bringing in new faces.
And the sale of winger Sancho, 24, who was banished back to Borussia Dortmund on loan in January after a bitter fall-out with boss Erik ten Hag, would give United significant room for manoeuvre.

Sancho’s position remains uncertain, with Chelsea among those said to be interested in him, while he has also been linked with a swap deal to Paris Saint-Germain which would see Manuel Ugarte head to Old Trafford. Despite his absence on Friday night, Ten Hag stressed his absence from the squad for the Fulham game was only due to an ear infection.
With superstar forward Kylian Mbappe now at Real Madrid, reinforcements are needed out wide at PSG, and Sancho, once touted to be one of Europe’s great wide-men, has caught their eye.

The only issue surrounding the deal may be United's lack of PSR wiggle room, as they have already spent big on Leny Yoro, Joshua Zirkzee, and Matthijs de Ligt during this window – so a sale would be preferable. The deal remains an unlikely one, but it could develop amid talks that reportedly began two weeks ago.
Mamardashvili joined Valencia, initially on loan, in the summer of 2021 from Dinamo Tbilisi in his native country, and still has three years left on his contract with the La Liga club.

Mamardashvili, meanwhile, has urged Valencia not to price him out of a dream move to Liverpool. The La Liga club are demanding £34million for the 23-year-old - and that asking price has proved too rich for the Reds. Liverpool have been unwilling to go beyond a package worth £30million, including add-ons for a player who will be No 2 behind Alisson.

Now Mamardashvili's advisers have urged Valencia to break the negotiating deadlock so that a deal can be done. The hope is that a compromise can be reached which would see Liverpool pay an initial £30million, with a small package of bonuses based on appearances.

There is a growing belief that Mamardashvili will become new Kop boss Arne Slot's first signing. The former Dinamo Tbilisi stopper was outstanding for Georgia at the Euros before they bowed out in the last 16 with a 4-1 defeat at the hands of Spain.
His arrival would mean Caoimhin Kelleher is surplus to requirements at Anfield, but there is no shortage of interest in the talented Irishman.

headline: Jamie Carragher makes definitive prediction on Man Utd's season after Fulham win
body: Jamie Carragher has made a strong prediction about Manchester United, with the Liverpool legend agreeing a £5,000 bet with Gary Neville about where they will finish
Jamie Carragher believes there is no chance Manchester United will finish in the top three this season, having agreed to a £5,000 bet for charity with Gary Neville.

Manchester City and Arsenal have been the two standout teams in recent seasons and they are widely expected to vie for the Premier League title once again this year. Carragher and Neville, meanwhile, believe both their former clubs will finish third and have decided to put their money where their mouths are.

During United's 1-0 win over Fulham, Neville revealed: "Me and Carra had a £5,000 bet for charity. A £5,000 bet for charity that Liverpool would finish above United or United would finish above Liverpool. Whoever loses it goes."

And Carragher has insisted there is no way United will make the top three, stating: "Man Utd will not finish third, I can assure you of that. They will be in a fight with Tottenham, Villa and Chelsea. They will be in the fight to get into the Champions League."

Carragher also believes United must "make Old Trafford a fortress again" if they are to compete this season, having suffered 19 defeats at home last season across all competitions. "Manchester United have to start really well," he told Sky Sports.

"It's obvious the hierarchy were looking for a new manager in the summer and they couldn't quite find one so they stuck with the manager they had. He's been allowed to make signings and spend money this summer, but that is the nature of being Manchester United boss.

"He'll know, and I’m sure everyone at the club will know, that the pressure will intensify if they don't make a good start, starting against Fulham on Friday. Fulham beat them at Old Trafford last season so United know they have to be stronger at home this time around.

"They need to try and make Old Trafford a fortress again because they lost too many games last season – 19 in all competitions. That's far too many for a club the size and the stature of Manchester United."

He is also backing City to win a fifth consecutive league title, adding: "Arsenal will be the closest challengers but Pep Guardiola, it doesn't matter what league he is in, more often than not he wins the league title.

"The only people that have managed to stop him are Jose Mourinho at Real Madrid one season and Jurgen Klopp with Liverpool a few seasons ago in the Premier League. That shows how tough it is and it has been tough on Arsenal with how close they have come in the last two season, but I know with Liverpool, Manchester City are a very difficult nut to crack."

headline: Gary Neville aimed savage dig at Matthijs de Ligt before summer signing's Man Utd debut
body: Matthijs de Ligt made his Manchester United debut in their 1-0 win over Fulham, but club legend Gary Neville has shared his concerns about the former Bayern Munich defender
Gary Neville has warned Matthijs de Ligt's lack of pace and mobility could prove a major weakness for Manchester United.

De Ligt made his debut off the bench as United beat Fulham 1-0 in their Premier League opener, having joined from Bayern Munich just three days earlier. And speaking ahead of De Ligt's debut, Neville highlighted his concerns about the Dutchman.

"I thought they would sign quicker centre-backs but he is aggressive," Neville told Sky Sports. "He's not the most mobile so Man Utd maybe won't push up the pitch like Arsenal, Liverpool and Manchester City have done.

"I thought Erik ten Hag might try and sign players that would allow them to really push up to the halfway line. I think with the midfield and the centre-backs that they've got with Maguire and Martinez still there and De Ligt they are going to end up playing a little deeper.
"It's not a problem but it is very different to how most of the top teams play. I don't think De Ligt's going to change that but he will provide some physicality and some presence."

However, Ten Hag believes De Ligt will prove an excellent addition at Old Trafford, insisting: "He has fantastic potential. Matthijs turns 25 this week and he has almost 375 games for Ajax, Juventus and Bayern Munich under his belt.
"That is incredible. Now he is turning into his best years. He has great skills as a football player, but also in his character, his personality. I am very pleased to have him here."

And De Ligt is confident he will fulfil his potential under Ten Hag, who previously managed him at Ajax. "Erik ten Hag shaped the early stages of my career, so he knows how to get the best out of me and I cannot wait to work with him again," he said.

"I know what it takes to succeed at the highest level, and I'm determined to continue that record at this special club. As soon as I heard that Manchester United wanted me, I felt an excitement about the opportunity for a new challenge at such an historic club.
"In the conversations that followed, I was impressed by the vision that the football leadership set out, and the role they saw for me in it."

headline: Erik ten Hag's injury crisis worsens as Man Utd star spotted on crutches
body: Manchester United kicked off the Premier League season with a win over Fulham but they remain without a number of experienced figures because of injuries sustained in pre-season
Victor Lindelof has been pictured relying on crutches to walk as Manchester United ’s early season injury crisis shows no signs of abating.
The Swedish centre back, who had been linked with a move away from Old Trafford earlier in the summer transfer window, missed the opening night win over Fulham.

And he has since been spotted hobbling with the aid of a crutch - in a short video clip posted on Instagram by his wife Maja that included the short caption: “Doing everything in slow motion these days.”

Lindelof is part of a walking-wounded list at Old Trafford also featuring new signing Leny Yoro, striker Rasmus Hojlund and left back Luke Shaw. But there remains a degree of mystery around the former's exact issue since head coach Erik ten Hag has not explained it.
Lindelof was taken off in the pre-season friendly against Liverpool in the United States with the issue described as “precautionary.”

But he was left out of the squad for last weekend’s Community Shield versus Manchester CIty and was not part of the group that edged out Fulham 1-0 thanks to debutant Josha Zirkzee’s late goal after coming off the bench.

Zirkzee, a £36.5million signing from Bologna, said: “To win here in my first home game and to grab a goal, it couldn’t be better. I’ve been told scoring at the Stretford End is one of the best feelings at Man United. I’m so thankful and blessed I could experience it in my first game. It’s an amazing feeling.

“At the end of the day we got the win, that’s all we wanted. I can’t really explain the feeling, it’s just very nice. I feel very warm here. It’s a great team. We want to achieve something great. It’s been amazing, it’s been a dream actually.”

Ten Hag named a back four featuring new signing Noussair Mazraoui while Matthijs de Ligt started on the bench. Asked about Zirkzee, the Dutch gaffer said: “Scoring for a striker is important and he should be where he was but he has more qualities and he has to get the right balance.

“He has to be arriving in the box to get the finishes, but we also want him to link up. We have some great midfielders around him to make up combinations. It’s the first game, but it’s good to strengthen the belief. I’ve seen many spaces where we have to improve, but that’s normal.”

Along with Lindelof’s injury, Yoro does not have a firm return date after breaking a foot in pre-season while Shaw is sidelined by a calf issue. Hojlund is expected to be missing for another month, while Tyrell Malacia is tipped to make a comeback in October after more than a year out following a serious knee injury. Academy product Will Fish also sustained a significant injury during pre-season.

headline: Wayne Rooney slammed by ex-Man Utd star in astonishing rant - 'He's being protected'
body: Dwight Yorke, who has had only one short spell managing a club in Australia, has said Wayne Rooney is only more disappointing spell away from realising management is not for him
Dwight Yorke has laid into Wayne Rooney’s managerial record by claiming the only reason he continues to get jobs is because friends within the game are “protecting him.”
Rooney copped plenty of flak after Plymouth Argyle began their Championship campaign with a 4-0 defeat away to Sheffield Wednesday last weekend.
And despite winning 3-0 against Cheltenham in the opening round of the EFL Cup on Wednesday evening, there is already pressure on Rooney, 38, to prove he is worth the hype as a gaffer.

Plymouth host Hull this afternoon but after Rooney fell short of succeeding at Derby County, DC United and Birmingham City, his fellow former Manchester United goalscorer Yorke is convinced he only continues to get work because of his connections.
“We have all tried to defend Wayne Rooney on his managerial record in the chances he has been given but you can only defend him for so long,” Yorke said.
‌”He’s got a real opportunity to show what he can do and show how he can get his team playing but they got off to the worst start possible.
‌”So far in management he’s been given chance after chance and done very little in terms of success, that’s out there and it’s well documented and you can only defend that record for so long.

“He needs to do better at management, simple. He's got friends in football that are protecting him and now he needs to give something back. I can defend him but he’s had the platform to succeed and so far he hasn’t delivered.”

‌Yorke, who was speaking to CSGOluck, has only one short managerial stint to his name - at Australian club Macarthur. And the 52-year-old hinted that Rooney is only one more disappointing spell away from it being clear that the job is not for him.
“You've got to show why you're worthy of being a manager and there will come a point in time when someone has to tell him the truth and the real truth about his managerial career," Yorke added.
“I give him the benefit of the doubt because I know Rooney himself, but he has to do better and that start hasn't helped him. If that continues, maybe management is not for him.
“I won't say that is the case just yet, but he's getting jobs because he’s Wayne Rooney. He needs to do better.”

headline: Lisandro Martinez confronts Jamie Carragher with perfect response to Man Utd jibes
body: Jamie Carragher was critical of Lisandro Martinez when the defender first joined Manchester United back in 2022 and the defender has clearly not forgotten his comments
Lisandro Martinez jokingly confronted Jamie Carragher about his criticism of the defender following Manchester United's 1-0 win over Fulham.

Joshua Zirkzee came off the bench to score a late winner on debut and Martinez, who started alongside Harry Maguire at centre-back, spoke with the Sky Sports pundits after the game and immediately took a light-hearted dig at Carragher.

The Liverpool legend notably claimed Martinez, who is 5ft 9in, would struggle in the Premier League after he joined United back in 2022. "We should never judge managers or players too early, but I'm convinced this can't work because the size of him playing in a back four," Carragher said.

"Maybe he could go left-back, maybe he could play in a back three, but in a back four, he cannot play there in the Premier League." And those comments were quickly referenced when Martinez joined a panel including Carragher, Gary Neville and Roy Keane following the win.
Neville asked Martinez: "When you first came to the Premier League there were a lot of comments about you because of the physicality of this league, how have you found it?"
Martinez then pointed at Carragher as he replied: "You mean from him." Carragher then walked over to Martinez and the pair compared their heights, with Carragher joking: "He is taller than me!"

Reflecting on the criticism, Martinez said: "As a player we are ready for everything. Criticise. It is part of our job. If you are here for excuses, you are not ready for this club. If you play bad, be ready for criticism.

"I was ready for that. I always believe in myself and my strength. I know I not really tall, but I will win, show with personality that I am there on the pitch." And Carragher was very complimentary of Martinez once the interview concluded.

"He has given you a tactical insight in terms of the team and other players," Carragher said. "He didn't come on and make excuses. We criticise players and give them praise. He was heavily criticised and said he didn't play his best, but that type of personality to front it… he is a warrior, I thought he came across brilliantly."
Keane then added: "It takes players a while to settle into the club, we should sometimes give players the benefit of the doubt."

headline: Marcus Rashford issues two-word Alejandro Garnacho verdict after Man Utd embarrassment
body: Alejandro Garnacho had a moment to forget for Manchester United against Fulham on Friday night with Marcus Rashford speaking to his team-mate at full-time at Old Trafford
Marcus Rashford could be seen telling Alejandro Garnacho "don't worry" after the winger's horror miss for Manchester United against Fulham.

Garnacho got a half-hour run-out from the bench, making a telling contribution when his cross was turned home by Joshua Zirkzee for the winner. Joy soon turned to embarrassment, though, with the winger firing wide of an open goal when presented with a golden chance to make it 2-0.
The Argentina international was visibly upset at full-time, having not had too long to reflect on his miss. However, Rashford was quick to console his team-mate.

It was the second season in a row in which United have begun the campaign with a 1-0 win. Last season's opening weekend victory over Wolves was followed by a tricky run, though, and manager Erik ten Hag will hope things go rather better this time out.

Speaking to the media after the win, United manager Erik ten Hag explained Garnacho and Zirkzee started on the bench because their international efforts saw them link up with the squad later than others. Garnacho was part of Argentina's Copa America winning squad, while Zirkzee was involved for the Netherlands as they reached the semi-finals of Euro 2024.

"I explained the same about Zirkzee, it is the same about Alejandro, you saw his background, he played in an FA Cup final and then in Copa America," Ten Hag said. "He had one game and then he had his break. He needed a break and we had to bring him into the tour.

"Fitness-wise, it would have been the best decision to be in the tour, to work on his fitness. After a long season as a young player, he needed a break. He came late into pre-season and we have players in wide areas who have performed very well. That is why he started on the bench."
Fulham boss Marco Silva felt the game could have gone the other way. His Fulham side won at Old Trafford last season, but couldn't repeat the trick this time around.

"There were chances for Man United, we had some moments too, two against one, with Andreas Pereira and Alex (Iwobi) against Maguire that we should have done much better," he said. "Four against two, three against two, so many counter attacks that with better decision, we have to create clear chances in that moment.

"In the last 10-15, minutes, the game went in the direction that we knew and the players, they were aware that you cannot let the game go in the emotional part. We know that is the part of the game where Man United are normal and they can punish, because the game is completely broken. If you keep your organisation and you are well organised, it is much more difficult for them."

headline: Erik ten Hag and Roy Keane in awkward Man Utd confrontation - 'I'll be waiting'
body: Manchester United left it late but kicked off their 2024-25 Premier League campaign with a season-opening win over Fulham on Friday night, and Erik ten Hag was grilled by Sky Sports' pundits
Roy Keane and Erik ten Hag had a tense exchange over criticism aimed at Manchester United, with the Sky Sports pundit insisting: "I'll be waiting".

The Red Devils left it late but kicked off their 2024-25 Premier League campaign with a season-opening win over Fulham on Friday night. The game was heading towards a scoreless draw at Old Trafford - but summer signing Joshua Zirkzee ensured United would begin the campaign with a victory as he stretched to smartly direct home fellow substitute Alejandro Garnacho’s cross in the 87th minute.

Ten Hag was understandably delighted following the result, and spoke to Sky Sports to give his thoughts to Keane, Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher. During the chat, it was Carragher and Neville who asked the majority of the questions, with Kelly Cates hosting Sky Sports' coverage.

Near the end of the interview, Ten Hag noticed that Keane had yet to ask a question and the manager said: "You’re quiet! You don’t want to kill the vibes?" Man Utd legend Keane responded: "Maybe next week!"

The pair then laughed, before former United midfielder Keane added: "I'll be waiting. Just keep winning... No problem!" Carragher and Neville awkwardly looked on before Ten Hag responded: "So simple."

Cates then brought Sky Sports' interview to an end, with Ten Hag seemingly in high spirits before parting ways with the three pundits. And the manager had plenty to smile about, having seen debutant Zirkzee hit the ground running.
It was Zirkzee's first appearance for the Red Devils, having reported late for pre-season after going to Euro 2024 with the Netherlands and the former Bologna forward enjoyed a debut to cherish.

“It is very good for a striker coming into Manchester United and to score the winning goal in his first game,” Ten Hag said. “I remember last season when Rasmus Hojlund in his first game scored a goal and we were all waiting on the halfway line, then VAR and after two minutes they came to the conclusion the ball was slightly over the line.

“Then it took long (for him to score his first Premier League goal) and he was so frustrated. For him, it’s very pleasing, very happy for him and that will encourage him. That will give him belief. For the fans, for everyone – it’s a very good start.”

Asked what made him want to sign Zirkzee, the United boss said: “There were more, he has some attributes we didn’t have. Straight (away) he showed it, but where he’s very good is his linking up, combinations.

“We have some good ball-playing offensive players, so they can take benefit from this. But what I wanted to say is he has to arrive in the box and to score goals, because the main attribute from a striker is score goals and he did. If it’s then the winner, then it’s very pleasing for everyone.”
Zirkzee was among three debutants on Friday night, with Noussair Mazraoui starting and Matthijs de Ligt brought off the bench following their Tuesday moves from Bayern Munich.

headline: Erik ten Hag explains Harry Maguire decision after Gary Neville called out 'awkward' moment
body: Manchester United centre-back Harry Maguire started his club's first game of the season ahead of new signing Matthijs de Ligt but was withdrawn during the final 10 minutes
Erik ten Hag confirmed Harry Maguire was suffering from a "problem" during Manchester United's win over Fulham, but eased injury concerns over the centre-back.

Maguire missed out on a spot in England's Euro 2024 squad after failing to recover in time from injury. He has been involved in his team's pre-season prepatations, though, and started the Premier League opener.

The former club captain partnered Lisandro Martinez at the back, with new signing Matthijs de Ligt starting the game on the bench. He left the field in the closing stages, though, in a double change which saw Maguire and Noussair Mazraoui replaced by De Ligt and Jonny Evans.

It was a frustrating end to the night for Maguire, who had earlier been booked for what former United captain Gary Neville described as an "awkward" dive. However, Ten Hag's outlook was a relatively positive one.
"Not injured, but I had to bring him off as he had a problem," Ten Hag told Sky Sports when asked about Maguire. "The win is so important, but I am so happy to have no injuries today."
United's win was a narrow one. Another of their new signings, Joshua Zirkzee, came off the bench and scored a late winner before Alejandro Garnacho missed a big chance to give the team a cushion.

"Scoring for a striker is important and he should be where he was, but he has more qualities and he has to get the right balance - he has to be arriving in the box to get the finishes, but we also want him to link up," the manager said. "We have some great midfielders around him to make up combinations."

It was a dream start for Zirkzee, who joined from Bologna in July to become United's first signing of the INEOS era. To win here in my first home game and to grab a goal, it couldn't be better," he said after the victory.

"I've been told [scoring at the Stretford End] is one of the best feelings at Man Utd. I'm so thankful and blessed I could experience it in my first game. It's an amazing feeling. At the end of the day we got the win, that's all we wanted. I can't really explain the feeling, it's just very nice.

"I feel very warm here. It's a great team. We want to achieve something great. It's been amazing, it's been a dream actually.The manager told me to bring an energy and help the team as much as possible, just that.

headline: Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher agree £5k charity bet as Roy Keane chooses winner
body: Sky Sports pundits Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher have shared details of their season-long bet on the fates of their former clubs Manchester United and Liverpool
Gary Neville and Jamie Carragher already face a battle for bragging rights between Manchester United and Liverpool's seasons, but this year there's also money on the line for the pair.

Former United captain Neville and ex-Liverpool star Carragher each believe their old employers will finish higher come the end of the season. And the pair appeared on Sky Sports on Friday to confirm they have made a large charity bet to put their money where their mouths are.

"Me and Carra had a £5,000 bet for charity," Neville told fellow pundit Roy Keane during Sky Sports' coverage of United's Premier League opener against Fulham on Friday. He then turned towards someone behind the camera to confirm the sum.
"A £5,000 bet for charity that Liverpool would finish above United or United would finish above Liverpool. Whoever loses it goes."
Keane was then asked who he believed would win the bet. After a pause, he suggested United would be above Liverpool come the end of the season.

Carragher stuck to his guns, though. "Man Utd will not finish third, I can assure you of that," he said. "They will be in a fight with Tottenham, Villa and Chelsea. They will be in the fight to get into the Champions League."

United finished down in eighth last term, some eight points outside the Champions League places and 22 adrift of Liverpool in third. The season before that, though, Erik ten Hag's side finished third while the Merseyside club missed out on Champions League qualification.

headline: Man Utd handed Jarrad Branthwaite transfer boost as Sean Dyche makes telling admission
body: Despite splashing out over £100million on two centre-backs this window, Manchester United remain in the running for Everton's Jarrad Branthwaite
Manchester United target Jarrad Branthwaite will not be stopped from leaving Everton due to the club's takeover struggles.

The Red Devils have gone big this window under new minority shareholder Sir Jim Ratcliffe, bolstering their attack with £36.5million Joshua Zirkzee while securing their defence with £58m Leny Yoro, and Bayern Munich pair Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui.

However, Everton's Branthwaite has been a target since the transfer window opened, and despite the arrival of two big-money centre-backs, and discrepancies regarding a fee for the Englishman, he is still on United's radar.

Erik ten Hag could be in luck regarding a move for the defender, too, as Toffees boss Sean Dyche has admitted that he can do very little to avoid the sale of the star players amidst the club's financial takeover turmoil.

"I'm confident that the club are going to do the best they can to make sure we’re competitive, said Dyche. "But, equally, the club's got an outside picture which is quite obvious and that’s not something I can control.

"They do need to balance the finances better, we've done a lot of work with that since I've been here, and Kev [Thelwell] obviously is included in that, on the playing side to bring money in and lower the wage bill. We've done a pretty fair job, I would say of that, but the bigger picture of the club is dependent on what money is needed at any given time."
Aston Villa's £50m purchase of pivotal Toffees midfielder Amadou Onana, a player they would've ideally kept, proves that the club are somewhat in financial disarray.

Branthwaite could be the next big name out the exit door should United act on their interest. The Mail reports that both clubs are currently apart on their valuations for the 22-year-old, with United not budging from £60m and Everton demanding £70m.

A move for the Englishman may seem unnecessary, considering the singing of Yoro and De Ligt and the presence of Lisandro Martinez. Yet, Martinez is incredibly prone to injury. Yoro already suffered a brutal three-month injury against Arsenal in pre-season, and De Ligt has missed plenty of games through injury during his young career.

With Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof tipped to be allowed to leave Old Trafford, a young homegrown player like Branthwaite could prove a fantastic option for Ten Hag. The defender may not be a slog to sign either due to the club's apparent issues.
The Friedkin Group (TFG) and private investment firm 777 Partners both faltered in their takeover bids for Everton, who will move into their new ground on Bramley-Moore Dock next season.
Crystal Palace minority John Textor is currently within a period of exclusivity to negotiate a takeover, but he must relinquish his 45% share in the Eagles to complete the purchase.

headline: Man Utd transfer news: Ugarte plan emerges after PSG blink first amid Sancho competition
body: Manchester United are still pursuing a transfer for Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Manuel Ugarte, with Jadon Sancho in talks to move in the opposite direction to France
Manchester United have kicked off their Premier League campaign, but work is still going on behind the scenes in the summer transfer window.

United have completed four transfers, with Joshua Zirkzee, Leny Yoro, Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui arriving for a combined fee of £145.5million. But they are still actively pursuing more deals, with Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Manuel Ugarte the number one priority for Erik ten Hag with two weeks left of the window.

Ten Hag knows that some exits are needed if they are to afford Ugate, who was bought by PSG for Sporting Lisbon for £51m last summer. Scott McTominay, Christian Eriksen and Casemiro are all the subject of interest from outside and could follow Aaron Wan-Bissaka out the door.
United’s success in the 2024/25 season – and Ten Hag’s chances of keeping his job – could depend on the next few weeks of transfer business. So let’s take a look at how things are going, shall we?
United are still focusing on the signing of Manuel Ugarte this summer and are confident they can get the deal done.

The MEN reports that United and Ugarte are on the same page in both being determined to get the transfer sorted. The only stumbling block is the difference in valuation between United and Paris Saint-Germain, who are insisting on around £50m despite having already brought in Joao Neves from Benfica for €60m (£51m).

Ugarte was left out of PSG’s squad for their match against Le Harve on Friday night and Luis Enrique wants to get rid of him in the coming weeks. It’ll be a case of who blinks first, it seems, but with Ugarte and United on the same page, it appears likely a deal will be done.
Much of the talks between United and PSG have centred on the idea of a swap deal involving Ugarte and Jadon Sancho, who is keen to leave United this summer.

United dismissed the idea of Marcus Rashford going the other way and are more than happy to do business for Sancho, who still has a frosty relationship with Ten Hag after their falling out last season.

United’s hand could have been strengthened by fresh interest from Chelsea, if reports from German publication Fussball News are to be believed. The Blues have already signed scores of players this summer, including the £54m winger Pedro Neto, yet are reportedly interested in signing Sancho on loan with an obligation to buy. He would be their 10th signing of the summer, if things went ahead.

The signings of De Ligt and Mazraoui has added to the Ten Hag-Ajax influence at United, with Andre Onana, Lisandro Martinez and Antony already on the books.

“First of all, it is club’s decision, none of them is only my decision,” he said. “It is always backed or even brought up through the scouting, recruitment, technical director, sporting director, it is a decision made by more than only one. headline: opinionJoshua Zirkzee showed Man Utd what they've been missing under Erik ten Hag
body: Joshua Zirkzee came off the substitutes' bench alongside Alejandro Garnacho in the 61st minute - and the duo combined to score Manchester United's winner vs Fulham
Joshua Zirkzee took just 28 minutes of his Manchester United career to show he could be the striker they so badly need.

United looked like they would be frustrated in this opening Premier League encounter as Fulham soaked up everything they could throw at them. Erik ten Hag brought on Zirkzee for his debut with half an hour remaining and the super sub repaid him by making the all-important breakthrough with just three minutes remaining to earn a 1-0 win.

It was a cool finish and suggests the Netherlands striker has more goals in him. Zirkzee, 23, scored 12 goals to help Bologna qualify for the Champions League last season and Ten Hag feels he can develop into the goalscorer they want.

His timing was perfect and up until that moment it seemed the best striker United had brought in this summer was Ruud van Nistelrooy. Unfortunately the bespectacled Van Nistelrooy has long since retired and the 48-year-old is back at Old Trafford as Ten Hag’s new assistant manager.

But compatriot Zirkzee, who grew up in The Netherlands pretending he was van Nistelrooy, could be the one. Goals are critical for United and their general play was good as England star Kobbie Mainoo buzzed about the pitch.

Ten Hag will be delighted with this win and United have carried on the momentum from last season when they stunned Manchester City to win the FA Cup. They can improve and there was some rustiness about their display, which is understandable after ten Hag claimed they were not ready for the start of the new season. But they kept a clean sheet and Ten Hag blooded defenders Noussair Mazraoui and Matthijs de Ligt.

Fulham will be gutted to lose so late on after holding United so well and they had their moments on the counter. They began the brighter and the rocket-powered Adama Traore skinned Lisandro Martinez down the left before firing over from another opportunity.

Debutant Emile Smith Rowe was pulling the strings in midfield for Fulham and Andre Onana made a fine right-handed save to touch away Kenny Tete’s 25-yard effort before it could nestle in the top corner.

United were furious they had not been awarded a penalty seconds earlier when Amad Diallo went down under a challenge from Antonee Robinson, but referee Robert Jones ruled there was no illegal contact. United grew into the game and Bernd Leno saved from Bruno Fernandes after passing straight to Casemiro on the edge of his area with an errant ball.

Casemiro fed Fernandes again and Leno did well to save his right-foot shot at close range. United kept pressing and Leno made another close-range save, this time from Mason Mount, before Mainoo fired just past the post from 20 yards out.

Fulham were still a threat and Rodrigo Muniz’s overhead kick came off Mainoo before Onana touched it over for a corner. Then just as it seemed United would be frustrated, Alejandro Garnacho swung the ball in from the right and the fellow substitute beat Scott McTominay to score past Leno. headline: Gary Neville worked second job at same time as appearing on Sky Sports for Man Utd game
body: Gary Neville made his debut on NBC Sports as a pundit for Manchester United's Premier League opener against Fulham, but he was also on punditry duty for Sky Sports
Gary Neville doubled up during the coverage of Manchester United and Fulham as he appeared on two broadcasts during the pre-match analysis of the Premier League opener.

The former United captain is a regular on TV screens, dishing out analysis for Sky Sports and also featuring on Euro 2024's coverage. Yet, he amazed everyone by juggling appearances on both Sky Sports and NBC Sports' pre-game discussions.

While he kicked off with Sky, alongside Roy Keane and Jamie Carragher, Neville vanished only to pop up on NBC's lineup alongside his old United teammate Tim Howard, presenter Rebecca Lowe, Robbie Earle and Robbie Mustoe. The appearance marked his first time on NBC, a move that was announced just a day prior, before Neville took to the gantry on co-commentary duty for the match.

NBC calls Neville a "special contributor" for this season. While Sundays are flagged for his main insights, they couldn't resist debuting the Red Devils' icon as the new campaign sparked into life at Old Trafford.

Neville was brutally honest about Manchester United's last season, saying to Sky: "They were a mess everywhere. Injuries were a mess, the balance of the team was a mess, midfield was a mess, the amount of goals they conceded and shots they conceded, they didn't score goals. There was very little right about Manchester United last season at all. The only positive was the FA Cup success. They've got to change everything, it's got to be so much better."

He went on to say that injuries and absentees cannot be an excuse for Erik ten Hag again this campaign, amid the Red Devils without Luke Shaw, Rasmus Hojlund, Leny Yoro, Jadon Sancho and Victor Lindelof for the opening game, Neville added: "Injuries can't be an excuse for United this season. You are either signing the wrong players or doing the wrong training, that has to be removed as an excuse."

Neville also praised the club's additions in the boardroom, with new executives CEO Omar Berrada, sporting director Dan Ashworth, and technical director Jason Wilcox all arriving at Old Trafford this summer as part of Sir Jim Ratcliffe and INEOS' shake-up after they took control of the football side of the club.

"I feel more optimistic because of the changes at the top and the negligence has been disrupted," and highlighting the improved quality of recent signings: "They have spent on the training ground but got some serious footballers in who are not going to make the same basic mistakes, the profile of player that has been signed is very different."

headline: Erik ten Hag explains why he left Jadon Sancho out of Man Utd win - "He could have played"
body: Jadon Sancho was left out of Manchester United's squad to face Fulham on Friday night amid negotiations over a potential swap deal for Paris Saint-Germain star Manuel Ugarte
Erik ten Hag has admitted that Jadon Sancho was fit enough to play for Manchester United against Fulham but simply didn’t make the squad.

Sancho came off the substitutes’ bench in the Community Shield defeat against Manchester City last weekend but was nowhere to be seen on Friday for the Premier League opener. Ten Hag opted to start with Amad on the right wing before introducing Alejandro Garnacho off the bench.

His decision paid off, with Garnacho setting up the game’s only goal for fellow sub Joshua Zirkzee in the 87th minute at Old Trafford. Garnacho should have made it 2-0 in the final minutes but fluffed a simple chance after Marcus Rashford squared to leave him with an open goal.

It was a positive start to the season for United, yet the absence of Sancho meant some awkward questions for Ten Hag to field in his post-match press conference. The Dutchman claims to have made peace with Sancho following last season’s falling out, but the winger could still leave in the closing stages of the summer transfer window.

“First of all we need squad depth, this season will be survival of the fittest, I can only put 20 players in the squad,” Ten Hag said. “Then Jadon in the week had an ear infection, he was not 100 per cent fit. He could play but we made the choice, we preferred [to have] others on the bench. But that can change. It will change.

“We can't play everyone the same, you see today how important the subs are. Sometimes frustrating for the player, but it's about team, club, there will be more players in this position, we expect them to fight for the club.”

Speaking in July, Ten Hag said of Sancho: “As we said, we've drawn the line. Manchester United needs good players and Jadon is a good player. We have drawn that line and we move on.” But the club are now actively trying to move the 24-year-old winger on.

Paris Saint-Germain are interested in signing Sancho after he showed glimpses of his old self during last season’s loan spell at Borussia Dortmund. And United are trying to use that interest as a way of landing PSG midfielder Manuel Ugarte, who is their number one target after bringing in Zirkzee, Leny Yoro, Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui for around £150million.

Sancho is keen to leave Old Trafford behind but his £250,000-a-week wages could once again prove to be a stumbling block for him. PSG are one of the few clubs who could afford to take him, having lost Kylian Mbappe to Real Madrid this summer.

"First game, but it is good to strengthen the belief. I have seen many spaces where we have to improve but that is normal."

headline: Chelsea boss Enzo Maresca issues brutal Ben Chilwell transfer message as Man Utd handed opening
body: Ben Chilwell is edging closer to the Chelsea exit door after Enzo Maresca indicated the left-back is free to leave the club in pursuit of regular playing time - something he cannot offer at Stamford Bridge

Enzo Maresca has told Ben Chilwell he is free to leave Chelsea.  The 27-year-old left-back has played just 64 minutes throughout pre-season and was an unused substitute in last weekend's 1-1 friendly draw against Inter Milan.  And Maresca has indicated the player does not feature within his plans, declaring: "At this moment, Chilly is with us. He has not been training in the past two days because he was a little bit ill.  "With Chilly it's quite clear, I love the way he trains, I love the way he is but the problem is that he struggles with us a little bit to find his best position.

"When you train everyday and you don't get minutes, it's not good for them and it's not good for me because I need to make decisions. For some players, it's sometimes better to leave and to go somewhere to get minutes. We will see what happens, the transfer window is open and we will see what happens."  It's been a tough summer for Chilwell, who was also left out of Gareth Southgate's squad for the European Championships. Marc Cucurella has made the left-back role his own in west London since nailing down a starting berth last season under Mauricio Pochettino, when he flourished as an inverted full-back. Manchester United are among the clubs in the market for a left-back and they are believed to be tracking Chilwell amid a host of other possible options.

Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia have both failed to prove their fitness ahead of the 2024-25 campaign as new signing Noussair Mazraoui was drafted in as a makeshift solution against Fulham.  Chilwell did not feature in any of Chelsea's final three pre-season friendlies and the club are now open to offers, even though he is yet to be drafted into Maresca's 'bomb squad' - a collection of players that have been frozen out of the first-team picture.  Meanwhile, the Italian tactician refused to be drawn on links to Victor Osimhen and Joao Felix, stating: "The only thing I can say is they are not our players, so it is not correct for me to talk about a Napoli player or an Atletico Madrid player. At this moment, the club knows exactly what I think in terms of what we need."  Chelsea remain in talks with Atletico over a move for Felix as if they fail to agree a transfer deal for the Portuguese attacker, Conor Gallagher's move in the opposite direction will collapse altogether and they will risk losing him on a free next summer, which could have damaging implications for FFP.

headline: Joshua Zirkzee nets late debut goal to give Man Utd win over Fulham - 5 talking points
body: MANCHESTER UNITED 1-0 FULHAM: Joshua Zirkzee climbs off the bench to score on his United debut to give Erik ten Hag's side a winning start to their Premier League campaign at Old Trafford
Joshua Zirkzee scored on debut to give Manchester United victory over Fulham on the opening day of the Premier League season.

United have splashed £150million on four new signings in the summer transfer window - and it was Zirkzee, a £36m arrival from Bologna, who made the difference. The Dutchman turned in fellow substitute Alejandro Garnacho's cross late on to win it for Erik ten Hag's side.
The goal came at the perfect time for United, who had otherwise looked uninspired at Old Trafford, but did have the better chances through Bruno Fernandes and Mason Mount.

United started sluggishly but mustered the only two real chances of the first half only for Fernandes to twice be denied by Bernd Leno after being played in by Casemiro. Mount tested Leno again but Fulham looked to be holding on for a point before Zirkzee's impact. Here are the talking points.

When the team sheet arrived at the new time of 75 minutes before kick-off, there was a brief glance to wonder how United would set up. The answer was: like they did in the FA Cup final win at the end of last season.

With Rasmus Hojlund unavailable and Joshua Zirkzee on the bench, Ten Hag opted for the now tried and tested formation of 4-2-2-2, or a narrow 4-4-4, depending on how you view it. With Marcus Rashford and Amad wide, the idea is that Fernandes and Mason Mount test the Fulham backline with runs into the box.

The strikerless formation took time to get going, but did show how it can function when Casemiro slid in Fernandes for the best chance of the first half. In general, though, it showed how important having a centre-forward will be for United this season, as the first half fizzled out.

Most of Fulham's threat came down the right-hand side in the form of Adama Traore. His pace is well-known in the Premier League, but it is still very hard to defend against - and United struggled at times.

There were just seven minutes on the clock when the former Wolves winger breezed past two United defenders, including Lisandro Martinez but couldn't pick out a team-mate in the middle. Martinez learned his lesson and ushered Traore out in a similar position.
Yet the threat of Traore's pace on the break was constant - and with Dalot pushing up high on the left, there were some nervy moments for the home side.
United's narrow box midfield has some benefits - it helps the team press from the front and can cause overloads in midfield - but there were also some clear weaknesses on show.

They mainly came on the counter-attack, with Fulham's best moments coming when they won back the ball with United out of shape. This happened on a handful of times, and they were very fortunate not to concede at least one goal.

Andreas Pereira fluffed a brilliant opportunity when he failed to find Alex Iwobi when two on one with Harry Maguire. And Martinez cleared Pereira's low cross after an Alejandro Garnacho dive at the other end left his side short-staffed. Ten Hag needs to iron out the mistakes, otherwise his team are going to pay the price this season.

Noussair Mazraoui came straight into the starting line-up just days after completing a transfer from Bayern Munich, but he didn't play at left-back as some might have expected. Instead, the Morocco international was fielded in his preferred right-back role. He put in a solid if unspectacular display, but Ten Hag will be desperate to get Luke Shaw back fit so Diogo Dalot doesn't have to play at left-back.

Matthijs de Ligt came off the substitutes' bench for United in the second half but there was little to get excited about. He didn't impacted the game much - and the sight of De Light and Jonny Evans climbing off the bench when United should have been chasing the game hardly inspired confidence.

Leno had a good game in goal for Fulham and appeared to have earned them a point before Zirkzee's impact. Garnacho sent in a hopeful low cross and the 23-year-old managed to get a scuffed touch onto the ball to send it into the bottom corner.

Zirkzee was United's first signing of the summer, but is perhaps the lowest profile, having come from Bologna. With Hojlund currently out, he has a great chance to show what he can do in the coming weeks - and he made the perfect start on Friday night.

headline: Man Utd target Manuel Ugarte pulled out of PSG squad and desperate to complete transfer
body: Manchester United's top transfer target for the remainder of the window Manuel Ugarte was left out of PSG's squad for the opening fixture, while Jadon Sancho is absent for United's match vs Fulham
Manuel Ugarte has been left out of Paris Saint-Germain's squad ahead of their opening Ligue 1 match against Le Havre.

The Uruguay international is Manchester United's top target as they look to strengthen in midfield before the end of the summer transfer window and will have been encouraged that the 23-year-old has not made the trip to Normandy to begin the season. United have been unable to come to an agreement over the valuation of the former Sporting CP star.

The Red Devils have tracked Ugarte throughout the summer, with the French giants open to his sale after splashing out €60million on 19-year-old Joao Neves from Benfica. PSG spent a similar figure on Ugarte last summer and have been hopeful of recouping the bulk of it, but may be under some pressure to sell.

Talks between the clubs have continued, with Ugarte's preference reported to be a move to Old Trafford just 12 months on from arriving in Paris. There is an expectation that a deal will get over the line.

United are expected to move on some of their midfield players before the end of the month, with Christian Eriksen and Scott McTominay both being linked to transfers. The latter has fielded interest from Napoli already this month.

While tracking Ugarte has proven difficult over recent weeks, United have also considered other midfielder stars. Burnley's Sander Berge has come under consideration in addition to brief interest in Real Sociedad's Martin Zubimendi.

Jadon Sancho has been touted as an option to send in the opposite direction this summer too. The winger, who spent the latter half of last season on loan with Borussia Dortmund has been left out of Manchester United's squad for their Premier League curtain-raiser against Fulham, and has been pitched as a player to send to PSG.
Sancho returned to United's first team squad during pre-season after meeting with Erik ten Hag. The 24-year-old missed a penalty against Manchester City in the Community Shield last weekend.
“He’s a very good penalty taker and I had - and have - no doubts to let him score a penalty," said Ten Hag. "Also in the future, he will take penalties.”

Ten Hag also noted the pair have put their problems behind them. He said: "As we said, we draw the line. Manchester United need good players and Jadon is a good player. We have drawn that line and we move on."

headline: Premier League clubs accused of fleecing fans with astronomical season ticket price hike
body: Supporters of Premier League clubs have been forced to pay more for their season tickets for the 2024/25 campaign, with 18 of the 20 sides guilty of hiking their prices
Premier League clubs have been accused of exploiting loyal fans after rising season ticket prices by up to 32 per cent.

As the new season kicks off on Friday night, 18 of the 20 teams have upped the price of their cheapest adult season tickets. The biggest sinners are the Saints – with newly promoted Southampton hiking the cheapest adult season ticket rising by £120 from £379 to £499. That is a 32 per cent increase and the biggest out of all the Premier League clubs.

A spokesperson for the side said: “After seven years of freezing prices, for the 2023/24 season, the club reduced the prices following relegation. We have been clear this season they will rise.” The club added that in recent years the cost of running match days has been increasing, including the price of energy and paying staff wages.
Arsenal are the dearest to follow. The north London side increased the price of the cheapest season ticket from £974 to £1,073. The club pointed to “an environment where costs continue to rise”.

Of the teams that played in the Premier League last season, Nottingham Forest have slapped the biggest price increase on their cheapest season tickets – with prices rising £85 from £465 to £550 – an 18 per cent rise.

Forest chairman Tom Cartledge told the club’s official website: “We aspire to keep our season cards amongst the most affordable in the league. At the same time, it is imperative that the club continues to grow financially in order to remain competitive, particularly in light of the forthcoming squad cost ratio rules, which will cap spending as a percentage of club revenues.”

Only Crystal Palace and Wolverhampton Wanderers have frozen the price of their cheapest adult season tickets. Consumer expert Scott Dixon said: “Fans were astonished to see these price hikes, given that the headline inflation rate is 2 per cent.

“The cost-of-living crisis is seen as an excuse by football clubs to justify price hikes and exploit loyal fans at every opportunity. Football clubs cite a variety of factors to justify it, hoping that fans will simply pay without questioning it.”

West Ham have the cheapest season ticket prices, following a comparatively modest price increase from £310 to £345. The average cost of the cheapest season ticket in the Premier League has increased to £598.83, up £41.28 from £558.55 last season – a 7 per cent increase.

Season tickets are not the only product that has seen rises this year. A recent Mirror investigation found more than half of Premier League clubs have hiked the price of replica shirts this season, some by 15 per cent.
The first Premier League game of the 2024/25 season will kick off on Friday at 8pm, with the first match taking place between Manchester United and Fulham at Old Trafford.

It’s a really strange situation with Marcus Rashford. There are very few players that are so good like Marcus and score 30 goals in a season and then go and score eight goals last season.

headline: Van Nistelrooy influence, Mazaroui praise and Netflix - Joshua Zirkzee opens up after Man United debut goal
body: Joshua Zirkzee strolled into the mixed zone and towered over a handful of journalists.
Zirkzee had just scored on his debut for Manchester United, a late matchwinner on the opening day of the season, but produced just a few words to describe how it made him feel.

"A great feeling, a great feeling, it couldn’t be any better," he said. Zirkzee was incredibly laidback in his first interview with club media last month and was equally relaxed when speaking to reporters, despite having scored the winner at Old Trafford around an hour previously.

"What can I say? Debut, winning, scoring in front of the Stretford End, so yeah, it’s unbelievable," Zirkzee added. Most players would still be riding the crest of the wave when speaking in the mixed zone after scoring on their debut but it was as if the 23-year-old had just played in a park.
Some may interpret Zirkzee doesn't care because of his laidback nature but it's part of his charm - there won't be an occasion that fazes him and that will help at the world's biggest club.

United are the most scrutinised team in the world and Zirkzee looks tailor-made to deal with the pressure, simply because he chooses not to feel it. "Where does this moment rank? Somewhere between my debuts and it’s a bit below winning the Champions League with Bayern and my national team debut, but it’s up there," he said with an endearing grin on his face.

"I'm just trying to be the best version I can be, help the team and club, so no specific goals." However, Zirkzee does want to start for United and many believed he should have featured in the Community Shield last weekend, a game in which even Jadon Sancho was used in.
"I’m sure the manager had a good reason for it, I’m not too difficult with these things. It’s his choice and today, my debut, wasn’t too bad," Zirkzee replied about that decision.

So is he a natural goalscorer? "I’m not going to talk about myself like that, but it was a good touch today, so hopefully more of that," said Zirkzee. "Not really [doesn't come naturally], it’s something you really have to work for and my role is probably what works best for the team.

"I’m a striker that’s comfortable coming in deep and helping the team play football, so it doesn’t really matter. This was my game in Italy [dropping in deep positions] and previously in Anderlecht, so that could be an option but if the manager needs me to do something else, I’m here."
Zirkzee became the sixth Dutchman to score on his Old Trafford debut for United after Jordi Cruyff, Ruud van Nistelrooy, Robin van Persie, Alexander Buttner and Donny van de Beek.
The goal extended United's opening day record in the Premier League - they have won more opening games than any other team - and also provided Zirkzee with 'relief'.
"I mean yeah, first game, first goal, it’s always a relief to have that off your shoulders, but it goes on," he explained. "I saw the replay of my goal and it didn’t look too bad."
United paid €42.5million (£35.8m) to sign Zirkzee from Bologna this summer and he made the best possible start to vindicating that investment by scoring the winner against Fulham.
"Why Manchester United?," he laughed. "For some people, it might be crazy, but for me, this is the biggest club in the world, so it wasn’t a difficult choice to make, to be honest."

Zirkzee is being coached by Ruud van Nistelrooy at Carrington and he described the opportunity to work with the legendary former striker as a privilege. "Yeah, it’s a privilege to have someone like that. As a striker, it’s not every day you have someone that you grew up watching," he said.
"That’s pretty much it, but everybody in the staff up to now has been great and I enjoy working with these people a lot. It’s not just him, but obviously it’s an extra privilege."
Van Nistelrooy is a familiar face to Zirkzee, given he idolised him as a child, but he has established friendships with United's latest signings, Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui.
"I mean they’re two great players and we’ll see in the future what they can bring," said Zirkzee, who played with both players during his time spent with Bayern Munich.

"I’m sure they’ll do a lot of great things here. I think Mazaroui had a great game today as well and I think De Ligt came in with a lot of good energy as well, so yeah, it’s good to have familiar faces around, but everybody in the team has been very kind and it’s top being part of this group.
"He [Mazraoui] arrived this week and it’s not easy to come into a team and play the way he did. I think it all looked natural and that was the most special part of his game today.
"But yeah, that’s just the player he is, he’s there to do his job and perform the best way he can and I think he did great today… and I'm not just saying that because he’s my friend!"
Most United fans will want Zirkzee to start against Brighton next weekend and in the meantime, they might find him walking his dog around the leafy suburbs of Manchester.

"I don’t do much, I have my dog, I take him for a walk and sit in the house and watch a TV series, play PlayStation or do whatever," he said about his hobbies. "I’ve just finished The Umbrella Academy on Netflix and it wasn’t too good of an ending but I enjoyed it, it was good."
If Zirkzee was any more laidback he'd be horizontal - he can deal with the pressure of United.

headline: Roy Keane fires nine-word demand to Erik ten Hag that Man United supporters will agree with
body: Former Manchester United captain Roy Keane sent Erik ten Hag a clear demand about results this season after a narrow victory over Fulham at Old Trafford.

The Reds were slow out of the blocks on Friday night but felt they could have been in front at the interval after Bruno Fernandes was denied twice. With the clash looking to be petering out, substitute and debutant Joshua Zirkzee expertly turned Alejandro Garnacho's cross into the back of the net.

While the match will not live long in the memory, the result is the perfect outcome for Ten Hag whose job was under severe pressure last season after the Reds finished eighth. The Dutchman received criticism across the board with Keane one of those to pick faults with the United squad.

During his post-match talk with Sky Sports, Ten Hag enjoyed a light-hearted conversation with Keane after host Kelly Cates noted the Irishman was quiet. "I am just listening. There is a vibe going on I am just chilling out," Keane explained.
"You don't want to spoil the vibe?" Ten Hag questioned, "Not tonight," the former captain replied.
"Next week, I know that," the United manager said. "I'll be waiting. Just keep winning, it's so simple," the 53-year-old said with a smile.

While we have become accustomed to Keane's dry humour, it is clear United fans will have been thinking the exact same as him last night. Supporters will be fully aware that the good 'vibe' will only stay at Old Trafford if the Reds can continue to bank the points this season.

headline: Man United get Ben Chilwell transfer green light as major £51m exit hint dropped
body: Manchester United got off to a winning start after a debut goal for Joshua Zirkzee earned a 1-0 triumph over Fulham.

It was by no means a gold standard performance from Erik ten Hag's side but they did enough to pick up their first win of the season - extending their formidable run on the opening day of the Premier League season.

United can sit back and relax for the rest of the weekend and watch the action unfold throughout the English top-flight as the likes of Liverpool, Manchester City, Arsenal, Chelsea and other contenders look to get off to winning starts.

Friday night saw a host of debuts with Noussair Mazraoui starting at right-back after signing from Bayern Munich this week. Match-winner Zirkzee and Matthijs de Ligt were second-half substitutes with the defender brought on in the latter stages to see the game out with Harry Maguire taken off as a precaution. With all that said, MEN Sport takes a look below at some of the latest media reports surrounding United as well as a view on each one...

"This morning we had 22 players training and if you ask all of them they want to play against City on Sunday but that is impossible," Chelsea manager Enzo Maresca said speaking ahead of Sunday's clash with reigning champions, City.

"When you train every day and not get any minutes it is not good for them or for me and I need to make a decision. Probably it is better to leave and go and get minutes. The transfer window is open so we will see what will happen."

According to BBC Sport, the new Chelsea manager has told England defender Ben Chilwell that he can leave the club this summer. The full-back has suffered with injury problems since arriving at Stamford Bridge.
And earlier this summer, Man United were linked with a move for the full-back. It was claimed that United were considering an approach for the left-back to bolster their full-back options.

MEN says: Friday night saw another makeshift left-back as Diogo Dalot was forced to filter over to that side while the new arrival started in the position on the right. Injuries have ravaged through United's ranks in the position with Luke Shaw and Tyrell Malacia on the treatment table and while there is a timeframe, there is always the challenge of getting up to speed with the Premier League intensity as well as forcing the returnee back is likely to spark more issues.
Chelsea's willingness to sell Chilwell could put United on alert as he may be available at a bargain price. With that being said, there is always a concern with the defender's injury record.

The Parisiens' curtain-raiser coincided with United's opener against Fulham but the Uruguayan was forced to watch on as PSG earned a commanding 4-1 win.

headline: Mason Greenwood sends clear message after Man United exit with instant Marseille impact
body: Former Manchester United attacker Mason Greenwood enjoyed a successful debut at Ligue 1 side Marseille as he scored twice in an emphatic 5-1 win over Brest.

The 22-year-old ended his association with the club this summer after completing a £26.6million move to France. Greenwood spent last season away from the North West as he enjoyed a successful loan at La Liga side Getafe after United decided 'it would be most appropriate for him' to continue his career away from Old Trafford.

Figures at Old Trafford believed his exit delivered on their commitment that he should continue his career elsewhere. Roberto De Zerbi took charge of Marseille, after leaving Brighton & Hove Albion, and got off to the perfect start in the French top-flight.
